issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task description) specifies addGuestStudents(int) as a void method that adds guest students to the lecture, but the solution implementation defines addGuestStudents(int) with a boolean return type and validation behavior. This is a signature/return-type mismatch: students following the specification will implement a void method, while the solution (reference) uses boolean, which can confuse students comparing to the solution and may cause tests or expectations to diverge.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem specification (and UML): change the solution method signature to public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) and implement it to update numberOfGuestStudents without returning a value. Alternatively, if the boolean return and validation are intentional, update the problem text and UML to document addGuestStudents(int): boolean and describe the return semantics (e.g., false for invalid input) so all artifacts match.
